questions.text: To protect a child’s privacy on social media, what should parents do?

options.text: Set the child’s account to private
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Private accounts reduce exposure to strangers.

options.text: Allow anyone to view and comment
options.feedback: ❌ This increases risks.
❌ Location sharing can expose safety risks.

questions.text: Which of the following is a risk of account sharing?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Others may post harmful content using the account.
❌ Sharing always reduces security.
❌ More followers don’t reduce risks.

questions.text: The best way to prevent children from being scammed in online games is:

options.text: Tell them not to trust 'free skins' offers
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This is a common scam tactic.

options.text: Let them trade freely with strangers
options.feedback: ❌ This can risk accounts and money.
❌ This is extremely dangerous.

questions.text: Which is a security measure parents should take?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct! It prevents unauthorized purchases.
❌ This increases risk.
❌ Unrestricted access poses dangers.

questions.text: When a child receives a friend request from a stranger, they should:

options.feedback: ❌ This can lead to scams or harassment.
✅ Correct! This is the safest choice.
❌ Revealing personal info is dangerous.

questions.text: Why should you avoid posting photos of a child in school uniform?

options.text: It may reveal the school location
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Background details may expose location.
❌ Blurriness has nothing to do with safety.
❌ Appearance is not a safety concern.

questions.text: The benefit of having parents review posts before publishing is:

options.text: Reduce risk of sharing sensitive info
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This prevents privacy leaks.
❌ The goal is to screen for risks, not delete everything.
❌ Review has nothing to do with likes.

questions.text: One important way to prevent online shopping scams is:

options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This helps prevent phishing.
❌ Super low prices are often traps.
❌ Never share payment info casually.

questions.text: If a child receives a text saying 'package undelivered' with a link, they should:

options.text: Click the link and fill out info
options.feedback: ❌ This is likely a phishing text.

options.text: Call the courier company’s official number
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Always verify through official channels.

options.text: Forward it to friends to click
options.feedback: ❌ This spreads the risk.

questions.text: Why should children’s location services be turned off in social apps?

options.text: To prevent strangers from knowing their location
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This protects privacy.
❌ While it might save data, the main reason is safety.
❌ This is unrelated to safety concerns.
